content.description: Around the right side of the same boulder as Kiddie Pool. Start matched on right facing rail, throw left to knobly ledge,  work up seam using crimps, and top out straight up.
content.location: Around the right side of the same boulder as Kiddie Pool, on the opposite side of the Aqua Boulder, on top the chossy boulder.

content.description: This is a perfect lowball boulder and pretty unusual for greenstone. A very cryptic problem that takes a lot of sussing out. Have fun figuring it out!
content.location: Opposite of the Gangrene Arete on the same flat area. Sit-Start left hand low on sloper feature and right hand slopey edge. Muscle your way up the sloper rail and then figure out how to surmount the boulder.

content.description: This is not on the aqua boulder, but instead on the boulder to the climbers right of the aqua boulder. The boulder's landing is completely on top of another chossy boulder. Sit down start on the right most part of the boulder on a very good right hand and a bad two finger left hand. Move left to a crimp and move left again to another crimp. Use the awesome blunt arete as a right hand and move into better holds to top out
Three consistently difficult moves be sure to use the green toe.
content.location: In the alcove uphill from the Piddle Paddle boulder. On the right arete of the boulder just left of Green Thumb and Green Knee boulder. Sit-start on broken jug feature. Compress your way up on two great sidepull edges and thrutch right to the lip to grab a perfect jug.There is a lowball project to the right of this line in the small corridor.

content.description: Steep climbing on good holds. Nice and low with a good landing.
content.location: Sit-Start of right side of alcove boulder on large edge in the steep overhang. Climb up using available holds. Body tension is important. Topout with a good old-fashioned blank rollover mantle. This is short steep boulder on top of the Piddle Paddle boulder.

content.description: This is an unusual problem for greenstone, it probably requires a bit of vision to understand.
content.location: Sit-Start on low edge on left side of alcove boulder. Move up to crimps on small face and traverse out of small corridor using more crimps and a fun knee scum. Traverse out to the center of the boulder and topout same as Green Thumb.

content.description: This problem climbs the fin of the boulder on top of the Kiddy Pool boulder. This may have been done in the past since it is quite a distinct feature.
content.location: Sit-start just left of tree and traverse lip a bit over half way to reach to sidepull jug on face to standup and topout. A full traverse could be done, but it would be way too spicy.

content.description: Sit down start and fire up to a large rail (I pinched it). Move right and top out the boulder.
Sit down start and move up on good crimps. Move into the topout using an undercling, slopers, and one amazing crimp.

This boulder is directly below the largest "diving" board. It has a massive dirty slab topout. After topping out the boulder on cannonball and belly-flop we just stacked pads and jumped off the boulder.
